standard treatment: abvd w/xrt
adriamycin [doxorubicin], bleomycin, vinblastine, dacarbazine

prognosis is good, especially for young pts with early-stage disease 5 year survival rate of 90%
• anterior (superior) mediastinal mass, surrounding the great vessels and aortic arch.
nodular sclerosing hodgkin’s lymphoma
mediastinal mass:
• thymoma 
- most common 1° anterior mediastinal mass (20%)
• lymphoma
• germ cell tumors
• mediastinal cysts
• pericardial, bronchogenic, enteric, thymic
• aneurysm of ascending aorta
• thyroid/parathyroid tissue
a previously healthy 23 y/o woman presents with a 4-month history of itchy skin, night sweats, and a 20-lb unintentional weight loss.
• signs & symptoms
often asymptomatic 
most common = painless lymphadenopathy
1/3 of pts present w/systemic symptoms
fatigue, generalized pruritis, “b” symptoms [low-grade fever, night sweats, weight loss]
mediastinal masses may also produce mass effects

• subtypes
nodular sclerosing
mixed cellularity 
lymphocyte-depleted
lymphocyte-rich
nodular lymphocyte-predominant

• nodular sclerosing subtype
most common subtype in the us
affects females > males
median age of onset = mid-20’s

• bimodal peak distribution of onset 
young adults (15-35) and late adulthood (>55)
associated with ebv and hiv
